PROPOSALS OF THE ITALIAN GOVERNMENT .Copies of Cypher Telegrams Nos. 269 and 270, from His Majesty's Charge d'Affaires at Romea dated .Sept ember l6th9. 19J55.(Circulated "by direction of the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, with reference to paragraph 2 of Telegram NOo 219 from Lord Tyrrell (Paris) - See CP. 218(33).)Whitehall Gardens, S.W.1.3 September 19th, 19330 From - ITALY.Decode.Mr. Murray (Rome).16th September, 19-33.5.30 p.m16 th SSeptember, 19 33.8.00 p.m16th SSeptember, 193 3No. 269.(R).o 0 a o li e ooooImmediate.My telegram No. 268.Baron Aloisi handed to me this morning memorandum m French, text of which is contained in my immediately-following telegram.He explained it was not in any sense draft agree-ment but represented suggestions which Italian Government put forward in the spirit of the Four Power Pact with a view to reconciling Franco-German divergence and finding of some escape from present deadlock of Disarmament Conference.Baron Aloisi replied affirmatively to an enquiry as to whether Italian Government had formulated these suggestions in the hope that they would be able to induce German Government to accept them provided that we could induce French to do likewise. He added that Captain Eden would recognise that they embodied many of his own ideas.As regards paragraph 2 I gathered that he did not take exception to reservations already made by His Majesty's Government.As regards paragraph 6, he said that by defensivearmaments-1- armaments Italian Government contemplated light tanks and fighter aeroplanes (compare anti-penultimate para-graph of my telegram under -reference).As regards paragraph 8 he said Italian Government accepted principle of control. 3y giving Germany arms mentioned in paragraph 6 functioning of Control Commission would he justified and it would at the same time he able to establish to what extent Germany had already re-armed as French probably with good reason maintained she had.In conclusion Baron Aloisi said that he would be here until September 20th or if necessary September 21st before going to Geneva in case Captain Eden proposed to come to Rome. From ITALY.Decypher. Mr. Murray (Rome). .16th September, 1933.P. 5.30 p.m., 16th September, 1933.R. 8.00 p.m. 16th September, 1933.No: 270.Immediat e. c ,Following is text referred to in my immediately preceding telegram:Disarmament.1. Convention pour l'abolition de toute espece de guerre chimique et bacteriologique. Destruction dans le delai de deux ans de toutes usines destinees a la preparation de ce genre de guerre, et de genre stocks prepares pour cette eventualite (instruments, machines, muni:, i ons , c . ) .2. Convention qui defend le bombardement aerien des populations civiles.3. Engagement, de la part des Stats Signataires, a proceder a une reduction des armes offensives aores la peri ode d'epreuve de la convention actuelle d'une duree non inferieure a. quatre armees.4. Engagement a ne pas depasser, pendant cette periode, le standing actuel oes arrnements terrestres et aeriena, ainsi que dera depenses y afferentes.5. Reduction et uniformisation des effectives terrestres d'apres les lignes du pro jet britannique.6. En relations aussi avec le point qui precede, concession aux puissances desarmees d'un quote-part des armes defensives. Le quote-part sera realise par etapes et par accords successifs.7. Le probleme naval sera reprise en examen a. 1'echeance du traite de Washington.8. Institution et fonctionnement du commission permanent du disarmament d'apres les lignes du plan britannique.9. Controle: partant du projet britannique, lui donner un caractere periodique, permanent ou automatique,10. La conference se reunira de nouveau le ler Janvier 1938 pour fixer les uiodalites de la seconde periode.
